page.title: 02BRAYDON RECREATION GENERAL
page.content: Recreational activities are rural pastimes of hunting, shooting, walking and cycling. Fox Hunting is not very good in this area because of the dense undergrowth and farmers dislike the Hunt trampling the heavy ground. There is clay pigeon and pheasant shooting in most parts of the area. Footpaths provide plenty of quiet country walks. Walkers are respectful of other people's property and not enough use the paths to cause erosion or damage. However, they are not too popular when they disturb the pheasants. The Wiltshire cycleway provides a pleasant ride through the countryside. Another popular pastime is gardening. Both vegetables and flowers are grown.
